column4: hi everyone! im having a problem logging as root, i know the password, but i justa cant, how do i go arround this?
if i use sudo, i get the messege that im not on the sudoers file. so iv tryed sudo viduso, no success.
tryed to login as root, i got login incorrect
but i cant use sudo, cause im not on the sudoers file
i have a problem with the .dmrc files, iv followed this steps https://help.ubuntu.com/community/dmrcErrors
The very first user - the one created during installation - is in sudoers.
Also, are you using the account created during install, or some other account?
Strange... you'll probably need to reboot into the "Recovery mode", and then use this command: adduser cparzewski admin
The 'recovery mode' will give you root access.
There's a recovery mode option in the boot menu. Once you select it, you'll get another menu - which has 'root' option at the end.
It is possible that your sudoers file, and probably other config files, have local hostnames in them.
Without network, the system _still_ tries to resolve those hostnames, but fails.
Can you check the output of 'hostname', 'hostname --fqdn', and the /etc/hosts file?
There should be a line "127.0.0.1 abulafia" in /etc/hosts, then.
